line_1: And talks of games of whist, and pig-tail pies;
line_2: From hence to WHITE'S our virtuous CATO flies,

line_1: And talks of games of whist, and pig-tail pies;
line_2: There sits with countenance erect, and wise,

line_1: An' bake them up in brunstane pies
line_2: Thae curst horse-leeches o' th' Excise,

line_1: An' bake them up in brunstane pies
line_2: Wha mak the Whisky stells their prize!

line_1: An' bake them up in brunstane pies
line_2: Haud up thy han' Deil! ance, twice, thrice!

line_1: For glorious puddings and immortal pies.
line_2: So from our works sublimer fumes shall rise:

line_1: Of fine potted Laver, fresh Oysters, and Pies!
line_2: While Notes of sweet Music contend with the Cries
